revised_title: Charles Bolton: A Pioneering Physician and Pathologist
tldr: Charles Bolton was a distinguished physician and pathologist who made significant contributions to the field of medicine. Born in Whitby, Yorkshire, he overcame challenges to become a competent doctor and later, a leading researcher. Bolton worked at University College Hospital, where he held various positions, including part-time Director of Research and lecturer in pathology. His research focused on human pathology, and he published numerous papers on various topics, including diphtheria and typhoid fever. Throughout his career, Bolton maintained a strong commitment to research and made a lasting impact on the medical field.
